name: The 40->52 Dex Barbarian Arcane Archer (Barbarian 8 / Wizard 2 / AA 30)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The 40->52 Dex Barbarian Arcane Archer

There aren't a lot of Barbarian AA builds in the ECB archives.
I am assuming this is because most players like to have Fighter in the build for Weapon Specialization / Epic Weapon Specialization (+6 dmg) and Bonus Feats, and to me that makes sense.
Or Paladin for divine damage. Or rogue for extra sneak attack, evasion and uncanny dodge/epic dodge. Or Bard for its amazing skills.
Barbarians have certain nice synergies with a high Dex AA, most importantly Uncanny Dodge (to protect the Dex AC at all times) which fighter, bard or paladin does not provide. 
The d12 hit die and barbarian speed also are nice along with a full BAB class.

Here I try to make the highest possible dex and AB AA while also having uncanny dodge. I thought I would share what I worked on.

It obtains ranged AB 63 and Dex 40->52 from Great Dexterity X.
It has base 344hp and a naked AC of 29. With +5 items and capped dexterity the AC hits 55 (63 with a +5 tower shield but he or she will always want to be shooting with a bow).
He or she will not want to be tanking damage however as it triggers attacks of opportunity. Tumble 20(35) with barbarian speed should help, along with the ability to use Wizard scrolls for summons, improved invisibility and haste.
The F22 W17 R34 saves don't look great on first glance, but there is +5 against spells and +2 against mind effects, so the effective fort save against most death magic and implosions is 27 and effective will save is 24, plus the wizard level allows for scrolls such as shadow shield (death magic immunity) and prot v alignment/mind blank (mind immunity), admittedly all dispellable but this is common to all combat builds. 
Also wizard robes tend to be cooler than the usual robes and the wizard level helps equipping those without UMD.
I put Int to 14 and Con to 8 to give the build stealth skills with all that dexterity, it can also set and retrieve up to deadly traps, and open DC 52 locks with a +10 pick and capped dexterity (16+20+10+6).
If stealth is not desired then Con can be put to 12 and Int to 10 for over 400 hp and +2 to fort.

I thought about putting weapon finesse in the build. With weapon finesse, any finessable mundane weapon would have an AB of 45 without needing any weapon focus feats. I figured this was not worthwhile given it would do very little damage (1d6 /17-20x2 +2-8) compared with the builds arrow damage (1-8 / 19-20x3 +15 +2-8 mighty plus arrow damage) but I can see how it might be attractive against a mob with a heavily enchanted flamed weapon'ed rapier and +5 tower shield. AA 30 was taken for the final bonus feat for Great Dexterity X but swapping wizard to bard and putting AA to 29 for a late spellcraft, tumble and discipline dump was also tempting for -1AB and 20% xp penalties.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I like the use of barbarian here.
AA 29 maxes out EA, but AA 30 gives that extra feat.
Personally I prefer bard over wizard in most AA builds, unless your third class is a tumble class. Here you want dex 40 and must go with Elf, so bard will give an XP penalty. Otherwise, I would choose half-elf and go bard/barbarian/AA. The AB will still be great.
